name: fidelis-edr
label: Fidelis EDR
description: Fidelis Endpoint EDR detects endpoint activity in real time and retrospectively so you can accelerate your response and stop adversaries at the point of entry. This connector supports following actions Get Alerts, Get Endpoints, Detete Endpoints, etc

fields.title: Server URL
fields.name: server
fields.description: Specify the URL or IP address of the Fidelis EDR server to which you will connect and perform automated operations.
fields.tooltip: URL of the Fidelis EDR server to which you will connect and perform automated operations.

fields.title: Username
fields.name: username
fields.description: Specify the username that is configured for your account to access the Fidelis EDR server to which you will connect and perform automated operations.
fields.tooltip: Username that is configured for your account for using the Fidelis server.

fields.title: Password
fields.name: password
fields.description: Specify the password that is configured for your account to access the Fidelis EDR server to which you will connect and perform automated operations.
fields.tooltip: Password that is configured for your account for using the Fidelis EDR server.

fields.title: Verify SSL
fields.name: verify_ssl
fields.description: Specifies whether the SSL certificate for the server is to be verified. By default, this option is selected, i.e., set to true.
fields.tooltip: Specifies whether the SSL certificate for the server is to be verified or not.

operations.title: Get Alerts
operations.description: Retrieves a list of all alerts or specific alerts from Fidelis EDR based on the input parameters you have specified.

parameters.title: Search String
parameters.name: facetSearch
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify a filter that you want to apply to the results of this operation. By default, this is set to an "empty" string
parameters.tooltip: A filter applied on results of the get operation. Defaults to empty string

parameters.title: Start Date
parameters.name: startDate
parameters.description: (Optional) Select the start time of the time range from when you want to retrieve alerts from Fidelis Endpoint EDR.
parameters.tooltip: The start of the time range of returned values. Date should be in the format of YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ss.sssZ

parameters.title: End Date
parameters.name: endDate
parameters.description: (Optional) Select the end time of the time range till when you want to retrieve alerts from Fidelis Endpoint EDR.
parameters.tooltip: The end of the time range of returned values. Date should be in the format of YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ss.sssZ

parameters.title: Offset
parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the index of the first item to be returned by this operation. This parameter is useful if you want to get a subset of records, say alerts starting from the 10th alert. By default, this is set as "0".
parameters.tooltip:
Specify the index of the first item to be returned by this operation. This
parameter is useful if you want to get a subset of records

parameters.title: Limit
parameters.name: take
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the maximum number of alerts that you want this operation to return in the response.By default, this is set to "all" alerts.
parameters.tooltip: Limit the number of alerts to return in response. default is set to 1000

parameters.title: Sort Alerts
parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the property name and order (Ascending or Descending) to sort the results retrieved by this operation, before applying take and skip. By default, this is set to "id Descending". You can specify the name of any property of the alert object.
parameters.tooltip: Sorts the result before applying take and skip. Defaults to "id Descending". Can be any property name of the alert object.

operations.title: Get Endpoints
operations.description: Retrieves information for specific endpoints from Fidelis EDR based on the offset, limit, and other input parameters you have specified.

parameters.title: Offset
parameters.name: startIndex
parameters.description: Specify the index of the first item to be returned by this operation. This parameter is useful if you want to get a subset of records, say endpoints starting from the 10th endpoint. By default, this is set as "0".
parameters.tooltip:
Specify the index of the first item to be returned by this operation. This
parameter is useful if you want to get a subset of records

parameters.title: Limit
parameters.name: count
parameters.description: Specify the maximum number of endpoints that you want this operation to return in the response.
parameters.tooltip: The number of endpoints to return in response

parameters.title: Sort
parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Specify the property name (and optionally the order) to sort the results retrieved by this operation, before applying the limit and offset. Examples of properties that can be specified are hostname, hostname descending, createdDate, createdDate descending, etc.
parameters.tooltip: Sorts the result before applying limit and offset. Examples: hostname, hostname descending, createdDate, createdDate descending.

operations.title: Get Endpoint By Name
operations.description: Retrieves theIDs of specific endpoints from Fidelis EDR based on the endpoint names you have specified.

parameters.title: Endpoint Names
parameters.name: nameArray
parameters.description: Specify the names of the endpoints in the "CSV" or "List" format whose IDs you want to retrieve from Fidelis EDR.
parameters.tooltip: Enter the endpoint names in csv or in list format

operations.title: Delete Endpoint
operations.description: Deletes specific endpoints from Fidelis EDR based on the endpoint IDs you have specified.

parameters.title: Endpoint ID
parameters.name: endpointID
parameters.description: Specify the ID of an endpoint that you want to delete from Fidelis EDR.
parameters.tooltip: Enter the endpoint ID which you wants to delete

operations.title: Get Playbooks
operations.description: Retrieves a list of playbooks and their details from Fidelis EDR.

parameters.title: Limit Playbooks
parameters.name: take
parameters.description: Specify the maximum number of playbooks that you want this operation to return in the response.
parameters.tooltip: Enter Number of items to return in response

operations.title: Get Playbooks And Scripts
operations.description: Retrieves details of all Fidelis playbooks and scripts or specific Fidelis playbooks and scripts from the Fidelis EDR based on the input parameters you have specified.

parameters.title: Type
parameters.name: filterType
parameters.description: (Optional) Select whether you want to retrieve script packages or playbooks from Fidelis EDR. By default, this is set as "2 - Script Packages".
parameters.tooltip: Enables you to filter between script packages and playbooks. Default it returns all values.

parameters.title: OS Platform
parameters.name: platformFilter
parameters.description: (Optional) Select the OS Platform for which you want to retrieve script packages or playbooks from Fidelis EDR. You can choose between All, Windows, Mac, or Linux.
parameters.tooltip: Enables you to choose between All, Windows, Mac, Linux.

parameters.title: Sorting Order
parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the property name and order (Ascending or Descending) to sort the results retrieved by this operation, before applying take and skip. By default, this is set to "name ascending".
parameters.tooltip: Sorts (ascending, descending) the result before applying take and skip. e.g name ascending

parameters.title: Limit
parameters.name: take
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the maximum number of alerts that you want this operation to return in the response. By default, this is set to "all" playbooks or scripts
parameters.tooltip: Limits the number of results returned. Defaults to all results.

parameters.title: Offset
parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the index of the first item to be returned by this operation. This parameter is useful if you want to get a subset of records, say playbooks or scripts starting from the 10th playbook or script. By default, this is set as "0".
parameters.tooltip:
Specify the index of the first item to be returned by this operation. This
parameter is useful if you want to get a subset of records

operations.title: Get Playbooks Details
operations.description: Retrieves details for a specific playbook from Fidelis EDR based on the playbook ID you have specified.

parameters.title: Playbook ID
parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Specify the unique ID of the playbook whose details you want to retrieve from Fidelis EDR.
parameters.tooltip: Unique ID of the playbook to get playbook details.

operations.title: Get API version Information
operations.description: Retrieves information on the API version from Fidelis EDR.

operations.title: Get Script Packages
operations.description: Retrieves a list of all script packages from Fidelis EDR.

operations.title: Get Script Packages File
operations.description: Retrieves the specific script packages file from Fidelis EDR and adds this script file to the "Attachment Module" in FortiSOAR based on the script package ID you have specified.

parameters.title: Script Package ID
parameters.name: scriptID
parameters.description: Specify the ID of the script package that you want to retrieve from Fidelis EDR. This operation also adds the retrieved script file to the "Attachment Module" in FortiSOAR.
parameters.tooltip: Enter Script Package ID to get its details

operations.title: Get Script Packages Manifest
operations.description: Retrieves the manifest for a specific script package from Fidelis EDR based on the script package ID you have specified.

parameters.title: Script Package ID
parameters.name: scriptID
parameters.description: Specify the ID of the script package whose package manifest you want to retrieve from Fidelis EDR.
parameters.tooltip: Enter Script Package ID to its Packages Manifest

operations.title: Get Script Packages Metadata
operations.description: Retrieves the metadata for a specific script package from Fidelis EDR based on the script package ID you have specified.

parameters.title: Script Package ID
parameters.name: scriptID
parameters.description: Specify the ID of the script package whose package metadata you want to retrieve from Fidelis EDR.
parameters.tooltip: Script Package ID to gets metadata

operations.title: Get Script Packages Template
operations.description: Retrieves the template for a specific script package from Fidelis EDR based on the script package ID you have specified.

parameters.title: Script Package ID
parameters.name: scriptID
parameters.description: Specify the ID of the script package whose package template you want to retrieve from Fidelis EDR.
parameters.tooltip: Enter script package ID to get its template

operations.title: Execute Script Package
operations.description: Executes a specific script package on Fidelis EDR based on the script package ID, timeout value, host information, and other input parameters you have specified.

parameters.title: Script Package ID
parameters.name: scriptPackageId
parameters.description: Specify the ID of the script package you want to execute on Fidelis EDR.
parameters.tooltip: Script Package ID to execute

parameters.title: Timeout In Seconds
parameters.name: timeoutInSeconds
parameters.description: Specify the timeout value, in seconds, after which this operation will timeout.

parameters.title: Hosts
parameters.name: hosts
parameters.description: You can specify multiple endpoint IP addresses in the "hosts" key using the following format: ["10.91.96.110","10.91.96.216"]

parameters.title: Integration Outputs
parameters.name: integrationOutputs
parameters.description: (Optional) You can specify the export format, for use with integrated products, using the integration Outputskey, The value of the integration Outputskey is the name of the export type as specified in the configuration file. For example, "integrationOutputs":["CEFOutput","LEEFOutput"]. For more information, see the SIEM Integrations Guide.
parameters.tooltip: You can specify the export format.e.g ["CEFOutput","LEEFOutput"]

parameters.title: Questions
parameters.name: questions
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the key-value pair of question data. For example, {"paramNumber": 1,"question": "Type","answer": "","isOptional": "false","inputType": "text"}
parameters.tooltip: Enter key value pair of question data.e.g. {"paramNumber": 1,"question": "Type","answer": "","isOptional": "false","inputType": "text"}

operations.title: Get Script Job Results
operations.description: Retrieves the results of a script job from Fidelis EDR based on the job result ID you have specified.

parameters.title: Job Result ID
parameters.name: jobResultID
parameters.description: Specify the ID of the job whose result details you want to retrieve from Fidelis EDR.
parameters.tooltip: Enter Job Result ID to get its result details

operations.title: Execute Task
operations.description: Executes a task (run a script job or a playbook) on Fidelis Endpoint EDR based on the script package IDs and endpoint IDs you have specified.

parameters.title: Package ID
parameters.name: packageId
parameters.description: Specify the ID of the script package/playbook you want to execute on Fidelis EDR.
parameters.tooltip: Enter Package ID for task execution

parameters.title: IS Playbook Or Script
parameters.name: isplaybook
parameters.description: Select whether you want to run a script package or playbook onFidelis EDR.
parameters.tooltip: Select an option based on entered package ID is script or a playbook

parameters.title: Endpoint IDs
parameters.name: endpoints
parameters.description: Specify the IDs of the endpoints in the "CSV" or "List" format on which you want to execute the task.
parameters.tooltip: Enter list of Endpoints on which the task execution should happen

operations.title: Get Installed Software
operations.description: Retrieves a list of all installed Software from Fidelis EDR based on the input parameters you have specified.

parameters.title: Endpoint ID
parameters.name: endpointID
parameters.description: Specify the ID of an endpoint that you want to delete from Fidelis EDR.
parameters.tooltip: Enter the endpoint ID which you wants to delete

parameters.title: Search String
parameters.name: facetSearch
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify a filter that you want to apply to the results of this operation. By default, this is set to an "empty" string
parameters.tooltip: A filter applied on results of the get operation. Defaults to empty string

parameters.title: Offset
parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the index of the first item to be returned by this operation. This parameter is useful if you want to get a subset of records. By default, this is set as "0".
parameters.tooltip:
Specify the index of the first item to be returned by this operation. This
parameter is useful if you want to get a subset of records

parameters.title: Limit
parameters.name: take
parameters.description: (Optional) Limit the number of records to return in response. default is set to 1000
parameters.tooltip: Limit the number of records to return in response. default is set to 1000

parameters.title: Sort
parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the property name and order (Ascending or Descending) to sort the results retrieved by this operation, before applying take and skip. By default, this is set to "id Descending". You can specify the name of any property of the data object.
parameters.tooltip: Sorts the result before applying take and skip. Defaults to "id Descending". Can be any property name of the data object.

operations.title: Get Alert Responses
operations.description: Retrieves a list of all alerts responses from Fidelis EDR based on the input parameters you have specified.

parameters.title: Search
parameters.name: search
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify a filter to apply to the results of this operation. By default, this is set to an empty string
parameters.tooltip: A filter applied on results of the get operation. Defaults to empty string

parameters.title: Offset
parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the index of the first item to be returned by this operation. This parameter is useful if you want to get a subset of records, say alerts starting from the 10th alert. By default, this is set as 0.
parameters.tooltip:
Specify the index of the first item to be returned by this operation. This
parameter is useful if you want to get a subset of records

parameters.title: Columns
parameters.name: columns
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the columns alerts.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the columns  alerts.

parameters.title: Limit
parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the maximum number of alerts that you want this operation to return in the response. By default, this is set to all alerts.
parameters.tooltip: Limit the number of alerts to return in response. default is set to 1000

parameters.title: Sort
parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the property name and order (Ascending or Descending) to sort the results retrieved by this operation, before applying take and skip. By default, this is set to id Descending. You can specify the name of any property of the alert object.
parameters.tooltip: Sorts the result before applying take and skip. Defaults to "id Descending". Can be any property name of the alert object.

operations.title: Get Endpoints By Search Query
operations.description: Retrieves information for specific endpoints from Fidelis EDR based on the offset, limit, and other input parameters you have specified.

parameters.title: Start Range
parameters.description: Specify the index of the first item to be returned by this operation. This parameter is useful if you want to get a subset of records
parameters.name: startRange
parameters.tooltip:
Specify the index of the first item to be returned by this operation. This
parameter is useful if you want to get a subset of records

parameters.title: Count
parameters.description: Specify the maximum number of endpoints that you want this operation to return in the response.
parameters.name: count
parameters.tooltip: The number of endpoints to return in response

parameters.title: Search
parameters.description: Specify a filter that you want to apply to the results of this operation. By default, this is set to an empty string.
parameters.name: search
parameters.tooltip: Specify a filter that you want to apply to the results of this operation. By default, this is set to an "empty" string.

parameters.title: Sort
parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Specify the property name and order (Ascending or Descending) to sort the results retrieved by this operation, before applying take and skip. By default, this is set to id Descending. You can specify the name of any property of the data object.
parameters.tooltip: Sorts the result before applying take and skip. Defaults to "id Descending". Can be any property name of the data object.

parameters.title: Access Type
parameters.name: accessType
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify an access type that you want to apply to the results of this operation. By default, this is set to "0" string.

operations.title: Get Job Status By Job ID
operations.description: Retrieves the results of a script job from Fidelis EDR based on the job ID you have specified.

parameters.title: Job Result ID
parameters.name: jobResultID
parameters.description: Specify the ID of the job whose result details you want to retrieve from Fidelis EDR.
parameters.tooltip: Enter Job Result ID to get its result details

operations.title: Create Custom Task
operations.description: Executes a task (run a script job or a playbook) on Fidelis Endpoint EDR based on the script package IDs and endpoint IDs you have specified.

parameters.title: Package ID
parameters.name: packageId
parameters.description: Specify the ID of the script package/playbook you want to execute on Fidelis EDR.
parameters.tooltip: Enter Package ID for task execution

parameters.title: Is Playbook Or Script
parameters.name: isplaybook
parameters.description: Select whether you want to run a script package or a playbook on Fidelis EDR.
parameters.tooltip: Select an option based on entered package ID being a script or a playbook

parameters.title: Endpoint IDs
parameters.name: endpoints
parameters.description: Specify the IDs of the endpoints, as comma-separated values or as a list, on which to execute the task.
parameters.tooltip: Enter list of Endpoints on which the task execution should happen

parameters.title: Integration Output Format
parameters.name: integration_output_format
parameters.description: Specify the format for the integration output.
parameters.tooltip: Enter the format for integration output

parameters.title: Script ID
parameters.name: script_id
parameters.description: Specify the script ID to be executed.
parameters.tooltip: Enter the script ID

parameters.title: Questions
parameters.name: questions
parameters.description: Specify the questions for the task.
parameters.tooltip: Enter the questions

parameters.title: Json Questions
parameters.name: json_questions
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify questions as a JSON.
parameters.tooltip: Enter the JSON questions

parameters.title: Timeout In Seconds
parameters.name: timeout_in_Seconds
parameters.description: Specify the timeout duration in seconds.
parameters.tooltip: Enter the timeout duration

parameters.title: Queue Expiration In Hours
parameters.name: queue_expiration_in_hours
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the queue expiration duration in hours.
parameters.tooltip: Enter the queue expiration duration
